description: 2-hour online exam assessing problem-solving skills across all course topics including lectures, tutorials, and workshops. Administered via Moodle during university examination period.

8 practical experiments with written reports focusing on advanced NMR techniques, organometallic catalysis, self-assembly, and enzyme kinetics. Reports submitted weekly with strict attendance requirements (minimum 7/8 sessions).

Three in-person assessments (weeks 4, 8, 10) testing application of course concepts through tasks like catalytic pathway analysis, binding constant calculations, and molecular system design. Conducted via Moodle during lab classes.
